title: Nicki Minaj releases a Fendi song
text:
From Harper's BAZAAR

Fashion has long been heralded by musicians - we've had Pharrell singing about Chanel, Jay Z's Tom Ford tribute and Cardi B's ode to the Louboutin - and now Nicki Minaj is waxing lyrical about Fendi.

The singer and rapper has released a song in celebration of her new clothing collaboration with the Italian fashion house. The song, simply titled 'Fendi', also features PnB Rock and Murda Beatz, and is available to stream and download from today.

For the accompanying collection campaign, Minaj was shot with models in Los Angeles by photographer Steven Klein.

Photo credit: Courtesy More

Minaj's capsule collection, Fendi Prints On, features statement clothing for men, women and children inspired by her signature bold, extroverted style; think futuristic-inspired pieces, elevated sportswear and oversized outerwear, all featuring that iconic double F logo - plus plenty of pink. The singer worked closely with Silvia Venturini Fendi and the design team to create a collection which was unmistakably her, but also deeply rooted in Fendi's playful and distinctive DNA.

Fendi showed their latest spring/summer 2020 collection at Milan Fashion Week earlier this month. It was the first without the 54-year creative directorship of Karl Lagerfeld, who died earlier this year aged 85.

Photo credit: Victor VIRGILE - Getty Images More

The Fendi capsule collection with Minaj will launch online on 14 October and will be sold in 52 Fendi boutiques worldwide from 16 October.

You Might Also Like
description: To celebrate her capsule collection with the Italian fashion house
